question: Question_04_(a)
statement:
In this question we are once again given 4 points
(\emph{x}\textsubscript{1}, \emph{y}\textsubscript{1}),
(\emph{x}\textsubscript{2}, \emph{y}\textsubscript{2}),
(\emph{x}\textsubscript{3}, \emph{y}\textsubscript{3}) and
(\emph{x}\textsubscript{4}, \emph{y}\textsubscript{4}) in the plane.
This time we want to find a quadratic function
$\displaystyle q(x) = ax^2 + bx + c$ that comes closest to going through
the points by doing a least squares fit.

\textbf{(a)} The least squares equation you need to solve to find the
coefficients \emph{a}, \emph{b} and \emph{c} has the form
\emph{A\textsuperscript{T}A\textbf{a} = A\textsuperscript{T}\textbf{b}}.
Write down expressions for \emph{A}, \textbf{\emph{a}} and
\textbf{\emph{b}}.
sols:
\emph{If} the quadratic polynomial could fit all four points, then these
conditions would be satisfied:

\begin{align*}
y_1 &=ax_1^2+bx_1+c\\
y_2 &= ax_2^2+bx_2+c\\
y_3 &= ax_3^2+bx_3+c\\
y_4 &= ax_4^2+bx_4+c\end{align*}

this is equivalent to:

\begin{align*}
\begin{pmatrix}
x_1^2 &x_1 &1 \\ 
x_2^2 &x_2 &1 \\ 
x_3^2 &x_3 & 1\\ 
x_4^2 & x_4 & 1
\end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix}
a\\ 
b\\ 
c
\end{pmatrix} &= \begin{pmatrix}
y_1\\ 
y_2\\ 
y_3\\ 
y_4
\end{pmatrix} \\
A\mathbf{a} &= \mathbf{b}\end{align*}.

However, we only have 3 unknowns and 4 equations, hence we ask for the
best solution (in the least square sense), which is found by solving
$A^TA\mathbf{a}=A^T\mathbf{b}$. Therefore,

\begin{align*}A=\begin{pmatrix}
x_1^2 &x_1 &1 \\ 
x_2^2 &x_2 &1 \\ 
x_3^2 &x_3 & 1\\ 
x_4^2 & x_4 & 1
\end{pmatrix}, \quad \mathbf{a} =\begin{pmatrix}
a\\ 
b\\ 
c
\end{pmatrix}, \quad \mathbf{b}=\begin{pmatrix}
y_1\\ 
y_2\\ 
y_3\\ 
y_4
\end{pmatrix}.\end{align*}
hints:
Write the conditions that \emph{q(x)} goes through all four points in
matrix notation. The values \emph{x\textsubscript{i}} and
\emph{y\textsubscript{i}} are known, and the values \emph{a}, \emph{b}
and \emph{c} are unknown.
